6 ... g6 7. Qe2
7 ... b5

7 ... b5

8. Nxh7

8 ... Qh4 9. Kd1

White has Qxf2-exf5.
7 ... Bb4

7 ... Bb4

8. Nxh7

7 ... fxg4

7 ... fxg4

8. Bg5

8 ... Qf6 9. f4

9 ... Ng4 10. f5

10 ... Nf2 11. Qf3

11 ... Nxe4 is impossible because black can't develop the bishop from f8 with tempo after 12. fxe6.

11 ... Bb4

tba...

11 ... d5 12. Qg3

10 ... Ne3 11. Bh3

11 ... Ng2

12. Bxg2

tba...

10 ... Bb4

11. fxe6

11 ... O-O 12. Qf3

Black cannot take on f3 without losing the knight on g4, yet if black plays Kh8 white has Bf6-Kg8-Bg7 (or Bf6-Nxf6-Qf7-Rxf7-Bh3).

11 ... Ne3 12. Bh3 O-O 13. Qf3

11 ... Ne3 followed by 12 ... O-O is even worse since it allows white to develop the light-squared bishop

10 ... Ba3

Suppose black moves the bishop to a3, not b4.

11. fxe6 O-O 12. Qf3

12 ... Rf4

13. Qxf4

13 ... Bxb2

14. Bc4 d5 15. O-O

13 ... d5

Rather than taking on b2, black plays 13 ... d5.

14. Bh3

14 ... Bg4

15. O-O Bf3

16. bxa3

16 ... Nd7 17. e5

(white is winning here)

14 ... Nd7

Say black brings the knight out earlier.

15. O-O Nf6

16. bxa3

16 ... Bg4

17. Bxg4 Ng4

18. h4 Nf2

19. exd5

19 ... Re8 is met with 20. Rfe1 (or 20. Ne4), so black's alternative is 19 ... Rf8 and 20 ... Rf3.

19 ... Rf8 20. Rae1 Rf3

21. Re8 Kf7 22. Ne4

9 ... Na6

10. Nb5

10 ... Nb4 11. Nc7 Kd8

12. Nxe6 Ke8

13. Be7 Bg7

14. Qg4

10 ... Ng4 11. f5

11 ... Bb4 12. c3

12 ... Qf8

7 ... Ba3

7 ... Ba3

8. bxa3?? fxg4

8. Nb5

After 8. Nb5, black can't play 8 ... fxg4 because of Nc7-Kf8-Qf3-Nf5-Bh6.

8 ... cxb5

9. Qb5 Nc6

10. Qb6

10 ... axb6 11. Bb5

11 ... Kf8 12. Bxd7

12 ... fxg4

13. bxa3 Ng4

14. f4 Nxh2

15. Ba3+ Ke8 16. d5

(= or +?)

10. Nf7

10 ... Qh4 11. Kd1

11 ... Bxb2

12. Nd7 Kf8 13. Nxb7

13 ... Kg7

Black threatens Rb8. White can't play Qc5 or Qb4 because of Rc8.

14. exf5

14 ... Rc8 15. c3

15 ... Nf5

16. gxf5

16 ... Kg8

17. Qh5

17 ... h6 18. Qxh4

18 ... g5=
